results.title: Alvar Aalto: technology and nature
results.creator_credit: Ywe Yalander, BBC Wales, WNYC-TV (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Oy Yleisradio Ab Svenska TV-enheten
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Born in Finland, Alvar Aalto (1898-1976) was one of the greatest architect and industrial designers of the 20th century. As a young man he rejected the ideals of art nouveau movement, preferring instead to follow his interests in functionalism. As a humanitarian he felt that democracy would be achieved by the mechanisation and standardisation of building practices, being the only way to give more to man. He also recognised the paradox of this and was to forever learn from nature, believing it to be the symbol of freedom. His architecture was widely accepted due to his success in marrying nature with art, man and mass production. But for Aalto, it was nature that was the great teacher, and nature that would provide the greatest inspiration to his work. Forever being influenced by the forests and nature broadly, his buildings would echo the elegance and asymmetry that expresses a natural order. Aalto’s humanitarian interests meant that the function of the building was always directed by the needs of the users. This earned Aalto lasting respect for his designs (i.e the Paimio Sanatorium has long been praised as one of the greatest buildings of the 20th Century), providing many humanitarian solutions to architectural problems. Aalto rejected synthetic materials and plastics, calling them, “drugstore architecture”, and preferred to use natural materials such as; wood, brick, stone, glass and ceramic tile. Aalto invested his interest in these materials and design to develop furniture and fittings to complete the interiors of his buildings. Aalto was most known in his industrial design for laminating and bending layers of birchwood to create bent wood furniture, a technique that has come to symbolise his home region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ywe Yalander, BBC Wales, WNYC-TV (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Oy Yleisradio Ab Svenska TV-enheten

results.title: Back to work
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Explores mothers returning to the workforce. Examines issues such as the costs of returning to the workforce, reasons for returning and childcare for preschool and school age children.

results.title: Discipline 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR Looks at why we discipline our children and the ways we do it, suggesting guidelines for starting the process with young children. Using dramatisations we look at the problem of aggressive behaviour and how to solve it without parents resorting to aggressive behaviour themselves.

results.title: On a budget
results.creator_credit: Chris Farrell, Peter Lindon and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Offers families advice on how to budget and save for the future in five 10 minute programmes. This series is recommended viewing for parents with young families, and offers practical and easy to implement strategies on a wide range of issues to do with parenting.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines types of toys appropriate for different age groups, storage hints, the issue of sexism and how to resist pressures from TV, advertising and cartoons.

results.title: Stress and Tension
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
The causes and symptoms of stress are examined here, and we look at ways parents can stop feeling tired and run down. A variety of relaxation techniques are demonstrated, and we discuss ways of relieving loneliness. Mothers talk about the stress associated with trying to live up to other people’s expectations, especially when it comes to housework, and we provide hints on how to ease the housework load. Parents describe how they dealt with the anger they felt from the continual demands of their children, and we show how our parenting is influenced by the way we were brought up and what we can do to change it. There are hints on how to manage the end of the day and we discuss the value of your relationship with your partner in reducing stress.

results.title: Toilet Training
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Some tips are given which may help to take some of the fear out of toilet training. The timing of toilet training is important and we provide advice to help parents recognise the signs and encourage the performance. We survey a range of pots, and discuss some of the emotional background to toilet training. We also discuss viewers’ letters and examine the subjects of constipation and urinary tract infection. The medical and therapeutic approach to bedwetting and faecal soiling are each explained and we complete this program by offering a selection of brief practical advice on toilet training.
